title: Russia and Ukraine Step Up Recruitment, Bracing for Fights Ahead
description: After a winter of intense battles and heavy losses in Ukraine’s east, both Russia and Ukraine are taking steps to replenish their depleted forces.

title: Espionage Charge Adds Hurdle to Freeing a Reporter Detained in Russia
description: The Biden administration recently secured the release of two Americans convicted of criminal charges in Russia, but even fabricated charges of spying can raise the stakes.

title: Bodies of 8 Migrants Found in River Along U.S.-Canadian Border
description: The authorities were searching for more bodies in the St. Lawrence River of migrants believed to have been attempting to cross illegally into the United States.

title: In Finland, Leaders Celebrate NATO Membership Progress
description: Finland’s president, Sauli Niinistö, said his country would “be a strong and capable ally, committed to the security of the alliance.”

title: Sanna Marin, Finland’s Political Rock Star, Could Be Slipping
description: Parliamentary elections on Sunday are extremely tight among three biggest parties, with the prime minister’s Social Democrats in a tough fight to lead the next government.

title: Putin Allies Must Decide Whether to Host a Wanted Man
description: The International Criminal Court’s arrest warrant for President Vladimir V. Putin could thrust his allies into domestic and foreign legal disputes, experts say.

title: What I’m Reading: Presidential Indictment Edition
description: Criminal cases against former leaders can be a positive sign about a country’s institutions. But of course politics often plays a role as well.

title: Now Playing in China: Putin-Aligned Artists Shunned in the West
description: As Russia works to shore up its image and rebuild its soft power after its invasion of Ukraine, it is strengthening cultural ties with friendly nations, including China.

title: Evan Gershkovich,WSJ Reporter Detained in Russia, Will Likely Spend Months in Prison
description: Russia detained Evan Gershkovich, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal, and accused him of espionage. The Journal and U.S. officials have vehemently denied the allegation.

title: Belarus, Echoing Russia, Raises Prospect of Nuclear Conflict
description: Because of the conflict in Ukraine, President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko of Belarus said, “a third world war loomed on the horizon with nuclear fires.”

title: With its arrest of an American reporter, Russia doubles down on isolation.
Oscar Pistorius, Olympian Convicted of Murder, Is Denied Parole
description: Mr. Pistorius, who has maintained that the killing was an accident and that he is remorseful, has served about half of his 15-year sentence.

title: How Democrats and Republicans Responded to Trump’s Indictment
description: While top Republican leaders defended the former president, Democrats called on him to respect the rule of law.

title: Pope Is Expected to Be Released From the Hospital on Saturday
description: Francis, who has been coping with a variety of health issues, was taken to the hospital on Wednesday. He is being treated with antibiotics for bronchitis, according to the Vatican.

title: Russia to Assume Rotating U.N. Security Council Presidency Despite Its War in Ukraine
description: There appeared to be no way to prevent Russia from taking on the largely ceremonial role, which rotates among the Council’s 15 members. Not all are critical of its invasion of Ukraine.

title: Donald Trump Indicted
description: He is the first former U.S. president to face criminal charges.

title: In a Land With No Soccer, Group Hopes to Use It to Score Climate Goals
description: The Marshall Islands Soccer Federation aims to draw interest in the sport — and to growing global warming events in the Pacific.

title: As Israel’s Crises Pile Up, a Far-Right Minister Is a Common Thread
description: Bezalel Smotrich, the finance minister, is a longtime advocate of contentious plans to overhaul the judiciary. He has also exacerbated tensions with Palestinians and Israel’s allies.

title: Eurozone Inflation Falls to 6.9%, as Energy Prices Ease
description: The rate of inflation in countries using the euro slipped to 6.9 percent in the year through March, from 8.5 percent the previous month, but underlying price gains edged higher.

title: For Ukrainian Convicts, a Strange Odyssey Through Russian Prisons
description: When Russian troops left Kherson, they took with them 2,500 Ukrainian convicts from local prisons. For some, it was the start of a bewildering, five-country journey highlighting the war’s absurdity.

title: French Anger at Macron Seeps Into Bordeaux
description: Even Bordeaux, known for its surrounding vineyards and conservative politics, has become a flashpoint. The City Hall’s charred doors attest to that.

title: Trump Indictment Is a First for the U.S. but Not for Other Nations
description: Scholars say it is important to hold the powerful legally accountable, but there are likely to be charges — well-founded or not — that prosecutors have political motives.

title: In Taiwan’s Waters, a Hunt for Tiny, Wriggling ‘Gold’
description: For generations, people have fished for baby eels in the island’s estuaries. But they seem to be getting harder to find.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Donald Trump was indicted.

title: 6 U.S. Service Members Suffered Traumatic Brain Injuries in Syria Attacks
description: The Pentagon said the injuries were diagnosed during routine screenings in the days after the strikes by Iranian-backed militants.

title: 6 U.S. Service Members Suffered Traumatic Brain Injuries in Syria Attacks
description: The Pentagon said the injuries were diagnosed during routine screenings in the days after the strikes by Iranian-backed militants.

title: In Arrest of US Reporter, Russia Doubles Down on Isolation From West
description: The Kremlin, which accused a Wall Street Journal correspondent of being a spy, made a move not seen since the Cold War, further raising the barriers between Russia and the West.

title: Turkey Approves Finland’s NATO Membership, a Defeat for Putin
description: Finland’s entry into the military alliance after Turkey formally signed off is a significant defeat for President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
